ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, interesting class without too much work.
Good introduction to film and a number of interesting topics - documentaries are truly great and I learned alot.

If you're interested in the subject and the time period, then absolutely. You'll get to watch a wide variety of really fascinating films, spanning from British Free Cinema to American countercultural works and even to avant garde Czech New Wave films like Daisies. Josh is the best. A really nice, laid-back, discussion-based course about great '60s films.
Overall a good class with an interesting selection of films. Worth taking if you're interested in documentary film.

A very interesting class with a light workload but a lot of rewards! I came in knowing pretty much nothing about documentary in the 1960s and left with a much deeper understanding of the different theories surrounding documentary at the time and the different global issues that were being tackled through film. I definitely think this class could be taken by people without a great previous knowledge of film or documentary.
